means: 计算(calculate的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Such a statement was hardly calculated to deter future immigrants.
sentence.Network_cn: 这样的声明不太可能吓住将来的移民。

sentence.Network_en: Interest is calculated daily and credited once a year, on 1 April.
sentence.Network_cn: 利息按天计算，每年4月1日一次性打入账户。

sentence.Network_en: There was nothing contrived or calculated about what he said.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说的话里没有任何蓄意捏造的成分。

entry.tran: 有意的;精心计划的;蓄谋的
entry.def: If something is calculated to have a particular effect, it is specially done or arranged in order to have that effect.

example.ex: Their movements through the region were calculated to terrify landowners into abandoning their holdings...
example.tran: 他们在该地区的行动是精心谋划的，意在恐吓土地所有者放弃手中的地产。

example.ex: These tracks were calculated to be controversial and attract attention to the album.
example.tran: 这些曲子意在引起争议,吸引人们关注这张专辑。

entry.def: If you say that something is not calculated to have a particular effect, you mean that it is unlikely to have that effect.

example.ex: Such a statement was hardly calculated to deter future immigrants.
example.tran: 这样的声明不太可能吓住将来的移民。

entry.def: You can describe a clever or dishonest action as calculated when it is very carefully planned or arranged.

example.ex: Irene's cleaning the floor had been a calculated attempt to cover up her crime.
example.tran: 艾琳擦洗地板就是为了蓄意掩盖她的罪行。

example.ex: ...a calculated and coherent strategy for winning power.
example.tran: 蓄谋已久、环环相扣的夺权策略

entry.tran: (风险)认为值得一试的，权衡考虑过的
entry.def: If you take a calculated risk, you do something which you think might be successful, although you have fully considered the possible bad consequences of your action.

example.ex: The President took a calculated political risk in throwing his full support behind the rebels.
example.tran: 总统全力支持反叛分子,对所冒的政治风险心中有数。

Sentence.sentence: They also calculated the cost savings emerging from the amount of disease that would be avoided because of lower blood pressure.
